p: Third, by helping transform the health sector in response to climate change, the HPSR community can demonstrate leadership and develop linkages both within and beyond the health sector to respond to climate change and create healthier populations (Healthier Societies for Healthy Populations Group, 2020). As the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic highlights, this is critical for a wider transformation towards a greater focus on sustainability. HPSR can deepen understandings of how to overcome policy obstacles both within and beyond the health sector, and how different actors are able to successfully (or unsuccessfully) pursue reforms. For example, an assessment found that efficiency gains from coherent multisectoral policies addressing energy use, health, climate change and air quality could save 40% of the total costs (International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis, 2012).
